tasks.task: Understand and explain the mission and technology of Drone AG.
subtasks: Explain the founding of Drone AG by Jack and Hugh Rangan in 2015.
Describe their approach to using their own farm as an R&D base.
Discuss the goal of making farming more productive with drone automation and AI.
Mention the projected market size for drones in agriculture by 2024.
Describe how Drone AG's Skippy Scout app automates drone flights for detailed crop imaging.
Explain the advantages of near real-time data and leaf-level zooming in the app.
Highlight the AI features for identifying crop cover, weed cover, and nutrient deficiencies.
Discuss the subscription-based service model with tiers for farmers and agronomists.
Outline the plans for expanding AI capabilities such as recognizing diseases and growth stages.

tasks.task: Outline the vision for integrating drone technology into farm operations.
subtasks: Explain the need for simple and practical solutions for farmers to adopt new technologies.
Discuss the real-time crop management and the use of drone sprayers.
Mention the goal of expanding user base to 30,000 by 2025.
